study_id.name: Study ID
study_id.description: A unique identifier assigned to a research study, project, or surveillance activity under which the sample or sequence was collected. It links multiple samples and datasets to a common research context or investigation, allowing traceability and aggregation of related data

fasta_file_name.name: FASTA File
fasta_file_name.description: The name of the file containing nucleotide or protein sequence(s) formatted in the FASTA standard. The filename serves as a reference to the physical data file associated with the sample or sequencing submission.

fasta_header_name.name: FASTA Header
fasta_header_name.description: The header line in a FASTA file that provides a unique identifier and optional descriptive information about the sequence that follows. It typically starts with a '>' character and is used to label and differentiate sequences within the file.

isolate_id.name: Isolate ID
isolate_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the isolate, as provided by the laboratory that originally isolated the isolate.

biosample_accession.name: BioSample Accession
biosample_accession.description: describes the identifier assigned to a BioSample in International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) archives

sra_accession.name: SRA Accession
sra_accession.description: describes the Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC)

specimen_collector_sample_id.name: Sample ID
specimen_collector_sample_id.description: The user-defined name for the sample

sample_collected_by.name: Collected By
sample_collected_by.description: the name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated

sample_collection_date.name: Collection Date
sample_collection_date.description: the date on which the sample was collected.

sample_receive_date.name: Received Date
sample_receive_date.description: A data field which describes the date on which the sample was received at the laboratory

specimen_source_material_category.name: Source Material
specimen_source_material_category.description: The type of material from which the specimen was obtained

specimen_source_context.name: Source Context
specimen_source_context.description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

biospecimen.name: Biospecimen
biospecimen.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes

other_specify_biospecimen.name: Other Biospecimen
other_specify_biospecimen.description: specifies the biospecimen type when 'Other' is selected in the biospecimen field

purpose_of_sampling.name: Sampling Purpose
purpose_of_sampling.description: describes the reason that the sample was collected

geo_loc_name_country.name: Country
geo_loc_name_country.description: country of origin of the sample

geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.name: Province
geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.description: describes the state, province, or territory of origin of the sample

geo_loc_name_city.name: City
geo_loc_name_city.description: the name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated

host_scientific_name.name: Scientific Name
host_scientific_name.description: A subject age at time of specimen extraction is the age (since birth) of the organism at the time a given specimen was extracted

other_specify_host_scientific_name.name: Other Scientific Name
other_specify_host_scientific_name.description: A subject age at time of specimen extraction is the age (since birth) of the organism at the time a given specimen was extracted

host_age_bin.name: Age Bin
host_age_bin.description: Age unit of the age measurement of a subject

host_age.name: Age
host_age.description: A host data field which describes the age of the host at the time of sampling

host_age_unit.name: Age Unit
host_age_unit.description: Age unit of the age measurement of a subject (individual organism)

subject_sex.name: Sex
subject_sex.description: A subject sex is the phenotypic sex of given subject (human or animal) related to a given investigation, study, and/or specimen

infection_acquisition.name: Infection Acquisition
infection_acquisition.description: a dataset that is about infectious disease acquisitions at particular times and particular places

finding_by_cause.name: Cause Finding
finding_by_cause.description: The result of a diagnostic or investigative process that identifies the underlying cause of a clinical, environmental, or laboratory finding. This may include the identification of a pathogen, chemical, or other agent responsible for an observed outcome.

host_disease.name: Disease
host_disease.description: A host data field which describes the name of the disease experienced by the host.

other_specify_host_disease.name: Other Disease
other_specify_host_disease.description: A host data field which describes the name of the disease experienced by the host.

host_disease_outcome.name: Disease Outcome
host_disease_outcome.description: A host data field which describes the disease outcome in the host.

host_health_state.name: Health State
host_health_state.description: A host field which describes the health status of the host at the time of sample collection

purpose_of_sequencing.name: Sequencing Purpose
purpose_of_sequencing.description: describes the reason that the sample was sequenced

sequencing_date.name: Sequencing Date
sequencing_date.description: describes the date the sample was sequenced.

sequencing_instrument.name: Sequencing Instrument
sequencing_instrument.description: describes the model of the sequencing instrument used

assembly_method.name: Assembly Method
assembly_method.description: Assembly method refers to how the reads were assembled into contigs for which either a de novo or mapping (reference based) strategy is used.

reference_genome_accession.name: Reference Accession
reference_genome_accession.description: the accession number of the reference genome

sequence_assembly_software_name.name: Assembly Software
sequence_assembly_software_name.description: The software tool used to assemble raw sequencing reads into a contiguous genome or sequence. Examples include SPAdes, Velvet, or Canu.

sequence_assembly_software_version.name: Software Version
sequence_assembly_software_version.description: The version number of the genome assembly software used. Versioning ensures reproducibility and helps track differences in results due to software updates.

depth_of_coverage.name: Coverage Depth
depth_of_coverage.description: The average number of sequencing reads that align to each base position in a genome or target region. Depth of coverage is a measure of how thoroughly a genome or sequence region has been sequenced; higher coverage generally improves accuracy of variant detection and assembly.

assembly_genome_size.name: Genome Size
assembly_genome_size.description: The assembly genome size is the sum of all lengths of a sequence assembly's contigs.

n50.name: N50 Value
n50.description: The length of the shortest read that together with other reads, represents at least 50% of the nucleotides in a set of

number_of_contigs.name: Contig Count
number_of_contigs.description: A contig count is the count of contigs that belong to a sequence assembly.

%_gc.name: GC Content
%_gc.description: The percent of a nucleotide sequence comprised of guanine and cytosine

K_type.name: K Type
K_type.description: The capsular polysaccharide type (K antigen) of a bacterial isolate, often used in Klebsiella species typing. K-type classification is based on the antigenic properties of the capsule and can be linked to virulence and epidemiology.

O_type.name: O Type
O_type.description: The O antigen type of a bacterial isolate, determined by the lipopolysaccharide (LPS) outer membrane structure. O-type is important for classification, epidemiology, and vaccine development.

wzi.name: wzi Allele
wzi.description: A gene encoding an outer membrane protein involved in capsule attachment in Klebsiella species. The sequence or allele of wzi can be used for capsule typing and epidemiological tracking.

sequencing_typing_method.name: Typing Method
sequencing_typing_method.description: The method or scheme used to determine the genetic type of an organism based on sequence data. This can include approaches like multilocus sequence typing (MLST), core genome MLST (cgMLST), single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) typing, or other genome-based typing schemes.

sequencing_type.name: Sequencing Type
sequencing_type.description: The sequence type assigned to an isolate according to a specific typing method. For example, in MLST, the sequence type is a numerical designation (ST) representing the allelic profile of multiple loci.

resistance_genes.name: Resistance Gene
resistance_genes.description: Genes detected in an organism that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. These genes may be located on the chromosome or mobile genetic elements such as plasmids or transposons. This field records the specific resistance genes identified in the sample.

other_specify_resistance_gene.name: Other Resistance Gene
other_specify_resistance_gene.description: Genes detected in an organism that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. These genes may be located on the chromosome or mobile genetic elements such as plasmids or transposons. This field records the specific resistance genes identified in the sample.

virulence_factor_gene.name: Virulence Gene
virulence_factor_gene.description: Gene encoding products that assist the bacterium colonize the host at the cellular level and are either secretory, membrane associated or cytosolic in nature.

other_specify_virulence_factor_gene.name: Other Virulence Gene
other_specify_virulence_factor_gene.description: Gene encoding products that assist the bacterium colonize the host at the cellular level and are either secretory, membrane associated or cytosolic in nature.

antimicrobial_resistant_plasmid_type.name: Resistant Plasmid
antimicrobial_resistant_plasmid_type.description: The type or classification of a plasmid carrying genes that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. This field records the plasmid’s incompatibility group, replicon type, or other identifiers used to categorize plasmids associated with antimicrobial resistance.

other_antimicrobial_resistant_plasmid_ty.name: Other Resistant Plasmid
other_antimicrobial_resistant_plasmid_ty.description: The type or classification of a plasmid carrying genes that confer resistance to one or more antimicrobial agents. This field records the plasmid’s incompatibility group, replicon type, or other identifiers used to categorize plasmids associated with antimicrobial resistance.

amikacin_resistance_phenotype.name: Amikacin Result
amikacin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for [Drug Name], indicating whether the organism is resistant, intermediate, or susceptible.

gentamycin_resistance_phenotype.name: Gentamycin Result
gentamycin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for [Drug Name], indicating whether the organism is resistant, intermediate, or susceptible.

tobramycin_resistance_phenotype.name: Tobramycin Result
tobramycin_resistance_phenotype.description: Phenotypic outcome of antimicrobial susceptibility testing for [Drug Name], indicating whether the organism is resistant, intermediate, or susceptible.
